flow.descriptionCdata:
13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.022c79d5-dfc2-4d53-929d-f0ebdaf28bf8.description=
Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers

Inputs\:
operator - The operation to perform (+, -, *, /, <, >, <\=, >\=, \=\=, \!\=).
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.06d3452c-37b5-4401-8e24-c920871a6506.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.16966824-83ba-4a6e-b6b0-f7ce2da727e2.prompt=Enter a value for value2 13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.1e62def9-9be0-45f2-9529-ebc667d7685a.prompt=Enter a value for value1 13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.228cadce-ac4f-4c61-88a6-0789bb4d53d0.description=
Retrieves the configured number of CPUs for a virtual machine.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).

Responses\:
success - Successfully retrieved the number of CPUs configured for the virtual machine.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
vmCpuCount - Number of CPUs configured for the virtual machine

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.27687aae-5e5d-46d7-9ba9-a801d0a64aff.prompt=Enter a value for value2 13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.2d9f3334-0ef6-4b56-a10e-03930120b312.description=
Retrieves the configured memory size for a virtual machine in megabytes.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).

Responses\:
success - Successfully retrieved the number of megabytes of memory configured for the virtual machine.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
vmMemorySize - Megabytes of memory configured for the virtual machine

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.305488f5-3d19-49be-b9a2-a70c06e2e0a0.prompt=Enter a value for value1 13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.3164f161-62ff-4ffb-81a5-58413aa85ca5.description=
Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers

Inputs\:

value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.34d1f44c-0685-45f6-930c-b604951bd538.prompt=Enter a value for value1 13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.353153a6-b5a7-43f1-8cc2-24dcc1ce6ec5.prompt=Enter a value for value1 13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.3a62a474-ff1c-4c91-9400-2d0eb897e1c5.prompt=Enter a value for value1 13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.5077f1ba-6d74-4f6b-9811-a621f77d8215.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.5e87450d-0c6d-4799-9439-d1c32ba532e6.prompt=Enter a value for value1 13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.75b6e500-ee82-4653-91d6-3c159615a611.prompt=Enter a value for value2 13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.7948a67e-a352-46e9-abae-b0b622bbf0a0.description=
Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers

Inputs\:
operator - The operation to perform (+, -, *, /, <, >, <\=, >\=, \=\=, \!\=).
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.93ea6ab1-79cb-4d0c-a18a-3587f1e72b1e.prompt=Enter a value for value2 13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.9f838c69-c9b9-4d89-bcad-6f0c59a1b18b.prompt=Enter a value for value2 13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.a46e6c23-ac19-499e-a0cc-7d4664d39b20.description=
Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers or strings

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.
operation - The operation to perform (+ - * ^ / > < \=\= \!\= >\= <\=).

Responses\:
success -  The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.

Returns\:
The raw result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false.

Returns\:
Field 1 - The first value. Here for compatibility
Field 2 - The second value. Here for compatibility
Field 3 - The operation. Here for compatibility
formatted_result - The formatted result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false.
13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.a6ca83d9-284d-4145-8154-3a666763aca2.description=Flex up a VM to the specific CPU Memory and Disk that is requested. Input Parameters\: serviceName -name of the service that will be created with this flow VCenterHost - vCenter host to execute against VCenterUsername - vCenter username VCenterPassword - vCenter password. virtualMachine - This is the virtual machine that will be flexed. dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs cpuCount - number of cpus the virtual machine should have. memSize - amount of memory the virtual machine should have. addDisk - whether or not disk should be added to the vm. Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: NA 13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.c8beb92d-82dc-4558-9fad-355cd7d65ebc.prompt=Enter a value for value2 13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.d21c0133-655d-4e88-aa66-37046b42e6ef.description=
Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers

Inputs\:
operator - The operation to perform (+, -, *, /, <, >, <\=, >\=, \=\=, \!\=).
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.description=
Flex up a VM to the specific CPU Memory and Disk that is requested.

Input Parameters\:
 host -  vCenter host to execute against
 user - vCenter username
 password - vCenter password
 port - Port Number toconnect on
 protocol - Connection prtocol(http, https)
 virtualMachine - This is the virtual machine that will be flexed.
 vmdataCenter -  target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs
 hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs
 availableCPU - Available CPU in  vCenter
 availableMemory - Available Memory in MB in vCenter
 cpuCount - CPUs required on the VM
 memSize - Memory in MB requried on VM
 flexup - Increase(true) or Decrease(false) CPU/Memory
 provision - true/false - Determines to allocate CPU /Memory

Responses\:
   success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0
   failure - otherwise

Result Fields\:
 NA
13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.f47cce08-6f7b-4d44-a05a-f863e4fc8c92.description=
Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers or strings

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.
operation - The operation to perform (+ - * ^ / > < \=\= \!\= >\= <\=).

Responses\:
success -  The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.

Returns\:
The raw result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false.

Returns\:
Field 1 - The first value. Here for compatibility
Field 2 - The second value. Here for compatibility
Field 3 - The operation. Here for compatibility
formatted_result - The formatted result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false.
13b5cc0d-0f5b-47ef-9e61-aaf3f165d130.fd3328e7-d603-4b80-9808-b657e7fa813a.description=Flex up a VM to the specific CPU Memory and Disk that is requested. Input Parameters\: serviceName -name of the service that will be created with this flow VCenterHost - vCenter host to execute against VCenterUsername - vCenter username VCenterPassword - vCenter password. virtualMachine - This is the virtual machine that will be flexed. dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs cpuCount - number of cpus the virtual machine should have. memSize - amount of memory the virtual machine should have. addDisk - whether or not disk should be added to the vm. Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: NA
flow.name: vCenter Flex CPU And Memory
